title: Wash in low degrees
description: Wash at 30 or 40 degrees instead of 60 degrees, as often as possible. This almost halves the energy use.

title: Travel by bike
description: Bike everywhere! According to the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency, transportation accounts for a third of Sweden's greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Travel by public transport
description: Go by public transport. According to the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency, transportation accounts for a third of Sweden's greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Eat vegetarian
description: Eat only vegetarian food for a whole day. According to the Swedish Board of Agriculture, animal products, such as meat, milk and cheese, account for a fifth of global greenhouse gas emissions.

title: By secondhand
description: Do you need to buy something? Buy secondhand! Our consumption of new gadgets accounts for a significant proportion of our greenhouse gas emissions through the industries that manufacture them.

title: Rent it
description: Instead of buying a gadget, rent it! Our consumption of new gadgets accounts for a significant proportion of our greenhouse gas emissions through the industries that manufacture them.

title: Pull the plug(s)
description: Taken together, the outlets in your home are likely powering about 65 different devices. Don't leave fully charged devices plugged into your home's outlets, unplug rarely used devices or plug them into power strips and timers, and adjust your computers and monitors to automatically power down to the lowest power mode when not in use.
